member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Internal.Design.TimeSpanUI.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Internal.Design.TimeSpanUI.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode
member.summary: Specifies how a DataSocket object transfers data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.Read
member.summary: Transfers data from the data source to the local DataSocket object when you establish the connection. Call Update to cause subsequent data transfers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.ReadAutoUpdate
member.summary: Transfers data from the data source to the local DataSocket object when you establish the connection. When the data at the data source is updated, the data is transferred again automatically. This mode is valid only for DSTP and logos and OPC data sources.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.ReadWriteAutoUpdate
member.summary: Transfers data from the data source to the local DataSocket object when you establish the connection. When the data at the data source is updated, the data is transferred again automatically. The DataSocket object automatically transfers data to the data target when you change any value or attribute on the local DataSocketData object. This mode is valid only for DSTP and logos data sources and targets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.Write
member.summary: Transfers data from the local DataSocket object to the data target at the time you establish the connection. Call Update to cause subsequent data transfers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.WriteAutoUpdate
member.summary: Transfers data from the local DataSocket object to the data target when you establish the connection. When you change any value or attribute on the local DataSocketData object, the DataSocket object automatically transfers data to the data target. This mode is valid only for DSTP and logos data targets.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.ReadBuffered
member.summary: Specifies that DataSocket is configured for manual updating with buffering. DataSocket gets the next value in the buffer from the DataSocket data source when the connection is established and when you call Update.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.ReadBufferedAutoUpdate
member.summary: Specifies that DataSocket is configured for automatic updating with buffering. DataSocket gets the next value from the DataSocket data source when the connection is established, when the data value changes, and when any of the data attributes change.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.AccessMode.ReadWriteBufferedAutoUpdate
member.summary: Specifies that DataSocket is configured for automatic updating with buffering. DataSocket transfers data to the DataSocket data source when the connection is established, when the data value changes, and when any of the data attributes change. DataSocket gets the data from the DataSocket data source when the data value changes and when any of the data attributes change.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatus
member.summary: Indicates the current status of the DataSocket connection.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatus.Connecting
member.summary: The DataSocket object is in the process of connecting to the data source or target.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatus.ConnectionActive
member.summary: The DataSocket object is connected to the data source or target and is transferring the data or waiting for an update.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatus.ConnectionError
member.summary: TheDataSocket object encountered an error while connecting to the data source or target.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatus.ConnectionIdle
member.summary: The DataSocket object is connected to the data source or target and is not currently transferring data or is waiting for an update.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatus.Unconnected
member.summary: The DataSocket object is not connected to any data source or data target.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.ConnectionStatusUpdatedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents a method that handles the ConnectionStatusUpdated event of a DataSocket object.
member.param: The source of the event.
A ConnectionStatusUpdatedEventArgs object that contains the event data.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket
member.summary:
Represents a connection to a data source or target.
You can use the NetworkVariable class library or the DataSocket class library to transfer live measurement data between applications over a network. You can use NetworkVariable or DataSocket to exchange different types of data between Measurement Studio, LabVIEW, LabWindows/CVI, and other applications that support NI-Publish Subscribe Protocol (psp:). NetworkVariable is the preferred method for transferring data between these applications, and, in these cases, NetworkVariable supersedes DataSocket. You can also use NetworkVariable and DataSocket to exchange different types of data between OLE for Process Control (opc:) servers. Exchanging data between Measurement Studio applications and OPC servers with NetworkVariable requires LabVIEW DSC Run-Time System. Use DataSocket to communicate directly with an OPC server.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket.Update
member.summary: Causes the DataSocket object to transfer data from a data source or to a data target.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket.SelectUrl
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket.SelectUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box with a specified URL.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket.SelectUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box URL and title.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.
Title of the dialog box.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket.SelectUrl(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box URL, title, and options.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.
Title of the dialog box.
Flags that control the behavior of the dialog box.
member.exception: options (parameter) is not a member of SelectOptions.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocket.SelectUrl(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box URL, title, options, and filter.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.
Title of the dialog box.
Flags that control the behavior of the dialog box.
Filter string passed to the dialog box, as shown in the following example: DataSocket Data files (*.dsd)|*.dsd|All files (*.*)|*.*
member.exception: startUrl (parameter) is null-or-title (parameter) is null-or-filter (parameter) is null.
options (parameter) is not a member of SelectOptions.

member.exception: The specified timeout is less than 0.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SyncWrite(System.Object,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initiates a write to the server with the specified data and TimeSpan.
member.param: The data to write to the server.
The timeout period specified as a TimeSpan.
member.returns: true if the operation timed out.
member.exception: The specified timeout is less than 0.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SyncRead(System.Int32)
member.summary: Synchronously polls the client-side buffer for unprocessed values using the specified timeout.
member.param: The timeout period specified in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the operation timed out.
member.exception: The specified timeout is less than 0.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SyncRead(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Synchronously polls the client-side buffer for unprocessed values using the specified TimeSpan.
member.param: The timeout period specified as a TimeSpan.
member.returns: true if the operation timed out.
member.exception: The specified timeout is less than 0.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.Update
member.summary: Causes the DataSocketBinding object to transfer data from a data source or to a data target.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SelectUrl
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SelectUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box with a specified URL.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SelectUrl(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box URL and title.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.
Title of the dialog box.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SelectUrl(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box URL, title, and options.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.
Title of the dialog box.
Flags that control the behavior of the dialog box.
member.exception: options (parameter) is not a member of SelectOptions.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Net.DataSocketBinding.SelectUrl(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Enables interactive browsing and selection of data sources or targets and configures the dialog box URL, title, options, and filter.
member.param: String that contains the URL. If the startUrl (parameter) protocol is opc:, dstp:, logos:, or file, or if you omit this parameter, this method opens a dialog box in which the user can find and select a data source or target. You can prompt the user to create a Web or FTP location with the http: or ftp: protocols. You also can use a complete URL, such as dstp://localhost/wave.
Title of the dialog box.
Flags that control the behavior of the dialog box.
Filter string passed to the dialog box, as shown in the following example: DataSocket Data files (*.dsd)|*.dsd|All files (*.*)|*.*
member.exception: startUrl (parameter) is null-or-title (parameter) is null-or-filter (parameter) is null.
options (parameter) is not a member of SelectOptions.

member.summary: Gets the total number of packets that is currently in the buffer divided by the maximum number of bytes allowed in the buffer.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus
member.summary: Defines valid values for the status subfield of the OPC quality attribute.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.Bad
member.summary: The value is bad.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.CommunicationFailure
member.summary: The communication failed, and no last known value is available.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.ConfigurationError
member.summary: There is a server-specific problem with the configuration.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.DeviceFailure
member.summary: A device failure has been detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.EguExceeded
member.summary: The value is outside the limits defined for this parameter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.Good
member.summary: The value is good.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.LastKnownValue
member.summary: Communication has failed, but the last known value is available.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.LastUsableValue
member.summary: The value is no longer being written.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.LocalOverride
member.summary: The value has been overridden.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.NotConnected
member.summary: The input must be logically connected to a server but it is disconnected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.OutOfService
member.summary: The block is off scan or locked.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.SensorCalibration
member.summary: The value has been pegged at one of the sensor limits or an internal diagnostics has detected that the sensor is out of calibration.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.SensorFailure
member.summary: A sensor failure has been detected.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.SubNormal
member.summary: The value is derived from multiple sources and has less than the required number of good sources.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.OpcStatus.Uncertain
member.summary: The value cannot be determined.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.ReadMode
member.summary: Specifies how a DataSocket object reads data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ReadMode.Asynchronous
member.summary: Specifies that DataSocket raises the DataUpdated event to notify when new data arrives.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.ReadMode.Synchronous
member.summary: Specifies that you must call SyncRead to poll and dequeue buffered data into the Data property. DataSocket does not raise the DataUpdated event in this mode.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions
member.summary: Controls the behavior of the dialog box that SelectUrl displays.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.Default
member.summary: Specifies that SelectUrl dialog box is displayed with the default options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.CreatePrompt
member.summary: Opens a dialog box to prompt the user for permission to create the file if that file does not exist. If the user chooses to create the file, the dialog box closes and the method returns the specified name; otherwise, the dialog box remains open.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.FileMustExist
member.summary: Specifies that the user can enter the names only of existing files in the Filename field. If this flag is specified and the user enters an invalid name, the dialog box displays a warning in a message box.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.HideReadonly
member.summary: Hides the read-only checkbox.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.NoChangeDir
member.summary: Restores the current directory to its original value if the user changed the directory while searching for files.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.NoDereferenceLinks
member.summary: Directs the dialog box to return the path and filename of the selected shortcut (.lnk) file. If this value is not provided, the dialog box returns the path and filename of the file referenced by the shortcut.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.NoReadonlyReturn
member.summary: Specifies that the returned file does not have the read-only checkbox selected and is not in a write-protected directory.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.NoTestFileCreate
member.summary: Specifies that the file is not created before the dialog box is closed. Use this value if the application saves the file on a create-nonmodify network share. When an application specifies this flag, DataSocket does not check for write protection, a full disk, an open drive door, or network protection. Applications that use this flag must perform file operations carefully because a file cannot be reopened after it is closed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.OverWritePrompt
member.summary: Causes the Save As dialog box to generate a message box if the selected file already exists. The user must confirm overwriting the file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.PathMustExist
member.summary: Specifies that the user can enter only valid paths and filenames. If you use this value and the user enters an invalid path or filename in the Filename field, the dialog box method displays a warning in a message box.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.Readonly
member.summary: Causes the read-only checkbox to be checked when the dialog box is created.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Net.SelectOptions.SaveAs
member.summary: Causes the file dialog box to be a Save As dialog box instead of an Open File dialog box.
